element.value: I developed a website for the Hamburger Championship with approximately 20,000 lines of code. It was implemented using HTML, SCSS, CSS, JavaScript, and TypeScript, with Python and batch files used as auxiliary tools.

whatIDid.title: Car Test System
whatIDid.elements: I built a test system that measures the speed of cars at specific positions on the track. The system generates graphs visualizing acceleration behavior. I also authored the portfolio texts describing this system.

whatIDid.title: Reaction Game
whatIDid.elements: I programmed a reaction game for the team stand, simulating a race start and allowing visitors to measure and compare their own reaction times.

element.value: I developed a website for the German Championship with around 30,000 lines of code. The site was programmed using HTML, SCSS, CSS, JavaScript, and TypeScript, with Python and batch files used as additional tools.

I designed and built the complete pit display for the German Championship. The entire structure was constructed from MDF and fully manufactured by our team, with the full mechanical design created by me in Fusion 360. The pit display integrated the following components:
An improved reaction game originally developed for the Hamburger Championship
Custom mounts for cars at twice the original scale
A screen displaying our website and the car reveal

I developed a fully functional website for the World Championship. The project consists of approximately 40,000 lines of code and received over 2,300 visitors. It was implemented using HTML, SCSS, CSS, JavaScript, and TypeScript, with Python and batch files as additional tools.

whatIDid.title: Ball Bearing Test System (Air Impulse)
whatIDid.elements: I constructed and programmed a test system that accelerates wheels using a precisely timed air impulse. The air burst is timed with an accuracy of hundredths of a millisecond, while RPM values are measured every millisecond and plotted over time.

whatIDid.title: Ball Bearing Wear Test System
whatIDid.elements: I developed a test system simulating wheel wear across 20 races, representing the full lifecycle of a car. The wheels are accelerated using a predefined acceleration curve and abruptly decelerated at the end, similar to the track stop system.

whatIDid.title: Track Measurement System
whatIDid.elements: I further developed the track measurement system used to precisely measure car position and acceleration during runs.

whatIDid.title: Pit Display Construction for WM
whatIDid.elements: I designed the pit display construction using the item engineering system. The aluminum profiles were precision-cut and delivered directly by item.

whatIDid.title: Custom Mounts and Holders
whatIDid.elements: I designed and manufactured custom holders for mounting Scharlau plates, as well as additional holders for posters that were constructed on-site.

whatIDid.title: Miniature Race Track
whatIDid.elements: I built a miniature race track featuring scaled model cars based on our real race car, allowing visitors to compete against each other.

element.value: I created an interactive exhibition setup centered around a screen that displayed

elements.value: All content was controlled through a dedicated control website. Where you could swipe through the elements.

whatIDid.title: Engineering Construction Game
whatIDid.elements: I developed an interactive construction game where participants had to design a wheel in Solid Edge as quickly as possible based on a predefined sketch. The system automatically validated correctness and stored highscores. The application is written in C# with approximately 7,000 lines of code and communicates with my backend server to persist game data.
